alert.note: Alert for Eastern Dutchess; Eastern Greene; Eastern Ulster; Western Columbia; Western Dutchess (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Heat Advisory issued July 26 at 3:21PM EDT until July 27 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 7 PM EDT THURSDAY... ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the first Heat Advisory, heat index values of 95 to 100 expected. For the second Heat Advisory, heat index values of 98 to 104 expected. * WHERE...In Connecticut, Litchfield County. In New York, Eastern Greene, Western Columbia, Eastern Ulster and Dutchess Counties. * WHEN...For the first Heat Advisory, from noon to 7 PM EDT Thursday. For the second Heat Advisory, from noon to 8 PM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures and high humidity may cause heat illnesses to occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The hottest temperatures will occur in urban and valley locations Thursday and Friday during the mid to late afternoon.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Dutchess; Eastern Greene; Eastern Ulster; Western Columbia; Western Dutchess
